byline.contributor: Ileana Najarro and Kate Pastor contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By WINNIE HU and NOAH REMNICK

abstract: Family of recently deceased South Bronx man Carmelo Quiles wonder how he might have contracted Legionnaires' disease and worry for their own health; Quiles is one of at least eight people who have died in worst Legionnaires' outbreak in New York City history.
lead_paragraph: The family of Carmelo Quiles said they did not know how the man contracted the disease, and worried whether they, too, were at risk.

headline.main: Bronx Man’s Death From Legionnaires’ Disease Gives Family Cause to Worry
headline.print_headline: Grieving Family Worries, Wondering How a Bronx Man Got Legionnaires’

snippet: The family of Carmelo Quiles said they did not know how the man contracted the disease, and worried whether they, too, were at risk.
